ref:
D: How may I help you today?

P: I've been having, uhh, like, nasal congestion and I've been sneezing a lot, over these last couple of days, and I've also been having a sore throat.

D: Oh no, when did that start?

P: So the store throat started like 2 days ago.

D: OK, and since then you've developed this nasal congestion and sneezing as well?

P: Yeah exactly, it started a bit afterwards or around the same time.

D: Yeah, alright and have you have any other symptoms? Do you have a fever?

P: Uh, no, I don't think so.

D: OK, do you have any difficulties swallowing?

P: Uh, Yeah, it has been a bit sore when eating food, but it hasn't been so painful to prevent me from eating.

D: OK, do you have a cough?

P: No, I haven't had a cough. 

D: OK, uhm, and do you have a runny nose, any discharge? 

P: Uh, Yeah, there's been a little bit of a like watery discharge, my nose has been running.

D: Any ear pain or any pain in your cheeks or your head when you're bending over, anything like that?

P: Uh, yeah, now that you say it, yeah, when I was bending over to put my shoes on, I felt just a bit of pressure on the front of my face.

D: OK, and you haven't been feeling feverish or having having any chills, right?

P: No 

D: OK, any fatigue, malaise, any aches or pains?

P: Uh. no, I felt OK, that way, yeah.

D: Any rashes?

P: Uh, no. 

D: No, OK, Have you been up to date with your immunizations?

P: I have yes.

D: Alright, and just have a couple more questions just to see if anything else is going on. Do you have a headache at all?

P: Uh, yeah, I've had a headache, since this morning. It's pretty mild. It feels like my head is squeezing. I think, uh, I've had headaches like this before, if I don't sleep well or dehydrated.

D: Are you more stressed out than usual? Do you have exams or anything going on right now?

P: No, schools been pretty good. We've been doing a lot of stuff online, so uh, yeah that's been good.

D: OK, any, uh, do you find that your eyes are runny or red or anything like that?

P: Uh, no, I haven't noticed anything like that.

D: OK, alright and any difficulties breathing?

P: No. 

D: Any chest pain? 

P: No chest pain.

D: Ok, any pain in your belly or any problems with your bowel movements?

P: No 

D: OK, any urinary symptoms?

P: No

D: OK, alright good. So can you tell me if you have any medical conditions?

P: Uh, no, I had dermatitis when I was a kid but I haven't had any issues since. I remember using some creams for that but I haven't needed to use them recently.

D: OK, and any medications that you're taking currently, including over the counter pills?

P: I don't take anything currently.

D: OK, did you take any medications, to reduce the symptoms that you're having, the headache or the sore throat?

P: Oh sorry, yeah I used some Advil this morning. I think it was 400 milligrams.

D: OK and do you have any allergies?

P: Um, yeah, to cats.

D: Have you been around a cat recently?

P: No, we used to have a cat, but unfortunately we were unable to keep it because allergies were so bad.

D: Yeah, do you have any environmental allergies at all? 

P: Uhm, yeah sometimes in the spring or fall I can get like itchy eyes and a runny nose, so that's why I didn't think much about the runny nose at first, but with a sore throat and, been sneezing more, I thought to come in. 

D: Yeah, OK. So in terms of your, uh, so general information. Do you live alone or do you live with your parents or anyone else?

P: Yeah, I live with my mom, dad and a younger brother.

D: Alright, and are you currently working or going to school?

P: Yeah, I'm finishing up Grade 8 and we're doing the courses online.

D: OK, great so, have you spent any time outdoors or spent any time with people who you think might be sick?

P: Well, I've played some, like, basketball outside with one of the neighbors, but I don't think he's been sick.

D: OK, alright, and have you traveled anywhere recently?

P: No, I've been at home.

D: OK, uhm, alright, and do you, uhm, have you had these symptoms anytime recently before?

P: No, not that I can think of.

D: No, have you been tested for covid anytime in the recent past?

P: No, I haven't.

D: Have you taken any antibiotics recently?

P: No. 

D: OK, alright well it sounds like you're probably having just a common cold, likely viral. So, and seeing that it's only been two days, have your symptoms gotten better or worse in the past couple of days?

P: They've gotten worse since it's started.

D: Yeah, OK, well, it's only been two days so far, let's just keep an eye on your symptoms and see how you're doing. It might also be a good idea just to get a covid swab done, and if your symptoms continue to worsen, give me a call again and we can talk about it a little bit more and see if maybe a bacterial infection or if there's something else that's going on. You don't have any difficulties breathing, do you?

P: No, I don't.

D: Alright, OK, alright umm, we'll do a physical exam and then chat a little bit more after.

P: OK, thank you.
pred:

P: I've been having like nasal congestion and I've been sneezing a lot over these last couple of days. And I've also had a sore throat.
D: Oh, when did that start?
P: So the sore throat started like two days ago.
D: Hmm. OK, and since then, you've developed this nasal congestion and you've been sneezing as well.
P: Yeah, exactly. It started a bit afterwards.
D: OK. All right. And do you have any other symptoms? Down fever?
P: No, I don't. I don't think so.
D: OK, do you have any difficulty swallowing?
P: It... yeah, it has been a bit sore when eating food, but it hasn't been so painful to prevent me from eating.
D: OK, do you have a cough?
P: No, I haven't had a cough.
D: OK, and do you have a runny nose? Any discharge?
P: Yeah, there's been a little bit of watery discharge. My nose has been running.
D: Any ear pain or any pain in your cheeks or your head when you're bending over? Anything like that?
P: Yeah, now that you say it. Yeah, when I was bending over to put my shoes on, it felt just a bit of pressure on the front of my face.
D: OK, and you haven't been feeling feverish or having any chills, right?
P: No.
D: OK, any fatigue, malaise, any aches or pains?
P: I, no I felt OK.
D: Yeah, OK. That way, that way. Yeah. Any rashes?
P: No.
D: No. OK. Have you been up to date with your immunizations?
P: I have, yes.
D: All right. And just a couple more questions just to see if anything else is going on. Do you have a headache at all?
P: Yeah, I've had a headache since this morning. It's pretty mild. It feels like my head is squeezing. I think I've had headaches like this before. If I don't sleep well or I'm dehydrated.
D: Yeah. Are you more stressed out than usual? Do you have exams or anything going on right now?
P: No, school's been pretty good. We've been doing a lot of stuff online, so yeah, that's been good.
D: OK, do you find that your eyes are runny or red or anything like that?
P: No, I haven't noticed anything like that.
D: OK, all right. And any difficulties breathing?
P: No.
D: Any chest pain?
P: No chest pain.
D: OK, any pain in your belly or any problems with your bowel movements?
P: No.
D: OK. Any urinary symptoms?
P: No.
D: OK, all right, good. So can you tell me if you have any medical conditions?
P: No, I had dermatitis when I was a kid, but I haven't had any issues since. I used, I remember using some creams for that, but I haven't needed to use them recently.
D: OK, and any medications that you're taking currently, including over-the-counter pills?
P: I don't take anything currently.
D: OK, did you take any medications to reduce the symptoms that you're having, the headache or the sore throat?
P: Oh, sorry, yeah, I used some Advil this morning. I think it was 400 milligrams.
D: OK, and do you have any allergies?
P: Yeah, to cats.
D: Have you been around a cat recently?
P: No, we used to have a cat, but unfortunately, we were unable to keep it because the allergies were so bad.
D: Yeah, do you have any environmental allergies at all?
P: Yeah, sometimes in the spring or fall, I can get itchy eyes and a runny nose. So that's why I didn't think much about the runny nose at first, but with the sore throat and been sneezing more, I thought to come in.
D: Yeah. OK, so in terms of your general information, do you live alone or do you live with your parents or anyone else?
P: Yeah, I live with my mom, dad and a younger brother.
D: All right, and are you currently working or going to school?
P: Yeah, I'm finishing up grade eight and we're doing the courses online.
D: OK, great. So have you spent any time outdoors or spent time with people who you think might be sick?
P: Well, I've played some basketball outside with one of the neighbors, but I don't think he's been sick.
D: OK, all right. And have you traveled anywhere recently?
P: No, I've been at home.
D: OK, all right. And do you have you had these symptoms any time recently before? Have you?
P: No, not that I can think of.
D: No. Have you been tested for COVID any time in the recent past?
P: No, I haven't.
D: Have you taken any antibiotics recently?
P: No.
D: No, OK. All right. Well, it sounds like you're probably having just a common cold, likely viral. So I think that it's only been two days. Have your symptoms gotten better or worse in the past couple of days?
P: They've gotten worse since it started.
D: Yeah. OK, well, it's only been two days so far. Let's just keep an eye on your symptoms and see how you're doing. It might also be a good idea just to get a COVID swab done. And if your symptoms continue to worsen, give me a call again and we can talk about it a little bit more and see if maybe a bacterial infection or if there's something else that's going on. You don't have any difficulties breathing, do you?
P: No, I don't.
D: All right. OK. All right. We'll do a physical exam and then try a little bit more after.
P: OK, thank you.
